statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Papa Dia had 19 points and 15 rebounds as SMU held on for a 70-67 victory at Division III McMurry on Saturday night.
article.headline: Papa Dia's double-double helps SMU clip McMurry
article.linkText: Dia's double-double helps SMU clip McMurry
article.story: ABILENE, Texas -- Papa Dia had 19 points and 15 rebounds as SMU held on for a 70-67 victory at Division III McMurry on Saturday night. The visit by the Mustangs (6-4) is believed to be just the third time a Division I school has played at a Division III opponent. The Redlands (Calif.) hosted Villanova in 2003; Occidental (Calif.) College welcomed SMU last season. Jaden Isler, Steven Jones and Derek Sumpter scored 14 points each for McMurry (6-4), which led by 12 points early. But SMU came back and never trailed after the 9:04 mark of the first half. Isler's jumper cut the deficit to 68-65 with 42 seconds to play, but the Mustangs managed to keep possession -- and the clock running -- until six seconds remained. Both teams hit two free throws each afterward, with Jeremiah Samarrippas' pair giving SMU its winning cushion. Overall, McMurry held its own inside, outrebounding the Mustangs 39-31. Both teams had 28 points in the paint.
